item.title: Stocks Fall, Oil and Gold Up as Israel Hits Iran: Markets Wrap
item.description: Stocks fell along with equity-index futures and investors rushed to the safety of haven assets after Israel attacked Iran’s nuclear program sites in a major escalation of tensions in the Middle East. Crude oil jumped 9%, the biggest move in more than three years.
item.dc:creator: Anand Krishnamoorthy

item.title: Oil Spikes as Israeli Attacks on Iran Stoke Fears of Wider War
item.description: Oil surged as much as 13% after Israel carried out waves of military strikes against Iran, raising fears of a wider war in a region that accounts for a third of global crude production.
item.dc:creator: Rob Verdonck

media:content.media:description: Pipes near fuel and crude oil storage tanks at the Galp Energia SGPS SA Sines refinery plant in Sines, Portugal, on Tuesday, March 25, 2025. Galp expects its biofuels and green hydrogen projects located at the Sines refinery will be operating in mid-2026. Photographer: Goncalo Fonseca/Bloomberg

item.title: Dollar’s Haven Status Faces a Key Test After Israel Strikes Iran
item.description: Under pressure from all sides and with cracks in its global currency dominance a key market talking point this year, the dollar’s traditional role as a crisis haven faces a crucial test should Israel’s attack on Iran escalate.
item.dc:creator: Ruth Carson, Winnie Hsu

item.title: Pop Mart’s 200% Stock Rally Spurs Rush to Hike Price Targets
item.description: Wall Street analysts are rushing to raise price targets on Pop Mart International Group Ltd. following the success of its Labubu dolls.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: Israel-Iran Conflict Triggers Fear of ‘Death Spiral,’ Analysts Say
item.description: Israel’s early-morning strikes against Iran’s nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites on Friday prompted the Islamic Republic to vow a “harsh blow” against both Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government and the US, which denied any involvement.
item.dc:creator: Ben Westcott, Natalia Drozdiak, Jon Herskovitz

item.title: Chinese Firms In Talks to Join Group for Li Ka-Shing’s Ports
item.description: China’s largest shipping company is among the firms in talks to invest in a multinational consortium seeking to buy billionaire Li Ka-shing’s global ports, according to people familiar with the matter, in an effort to ease Beijing’s concerns over the controversial deal.
item.dc:creator: Shirley Zhao, Dong Cao, Manuel Baigorri

media:content.media:description: Li Ka-shing in 2016. Photographer: Justin Chin/Bloomberg

item.title: Israeli Attack on Iran Raises Risk of Wider Conflict, Bloomberg Economics Says
item.description: Israel’s attack on the Iranian nuclear program and its ballistic missile sites threatens to spark wider fighting in the Middle East that risks drawing in the US, according to Bloomberg Economics.

item.description: Britain’s statistics crisis is not unique — modern technology and changing habits are causing problems in many countries
item.dc:creator: Tom Rees, Molly Smith, Swati Pandey

item.title: The Asia Trade 13/6/25
item.description: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Iran Vows Retaliation After Israel Strikes Nuclear Program
item.description: Israel launched airstrikes against Iran's nuclear program and ballistic-missile sites early on Friday, a major escalation in the standoff between the two adversaries. Bloomberg's Ethan Bronner reports on the latest. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Oil Outlook in Flux as Analysts Revise Views After Israel Strike
item.description: Israel’s strike on Iran has injected a fresh bout of geopolitical risk into an oil market that has been in the doldrums due to concerns about the global economy and supply increases from OPEC+.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Chen, Yongchang Chin, Nicholas Lua, Weilun Soon, Srinidhi Ragavendran

media:content.media:description: A gas flare burns from a pipe aboard an offshore oil platform in the Persian Gulf's Salman Oil Field, operated by the National Iranian Offshore Oil Co., near Lavan island, Iran, on Thursday, Jan. 5. 2017. item.title: A $115 Billion Fund Manager Bets on Shortest Maturity India Debt
item.description: India’s economic growth is set to accelerate sharply, making the ultra short-end of the debt market the most attractive segment, according to one of the country’s top money managers.

item.title: GemLife Raises $486 Million in Australia’s Biggest IPO This Year

item.title: Gold Jumps After Israel Launches Strikes On Iran’s Nuclear Sites
item.description: Gold spiked after Israel conducted airstrikes targeting Iran’s nuclear sites and military leadership, raising fears over a significant escalation of hostilities in the Middle East.

item.title: MBK Seeks Buyer for Struggling Korean Retail Chain Homeplus

item.title: Israel Prime Minister Netanyahu on Iran Airstrikes
item.description: "Israel will never allow those who call for our annihilation to develop the means to achieve that goal,” says Israel Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, after Israel launched airstrikes against Iran’s nuclear program and military targets. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Zhejiang Sanhua Seeks $1 Billion in Hong Kong Listing
item.description: Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co. is seeking to raise as much as HK$8.12 billion ($1 billion) in its Hong Kong listing, the latest billion-dollar deal to drive the city’s recovery in share sales.
item.dc:creator: Dave Sebastian

media:content.media:description: A pedestrian looks out across Victoria Harbour towards the Hong Kong Island skyline in the Tsim Sha Tsui district of Hong Kong, China, on Sunday, June 23, 2024. Four years after Hong Kong began a sweeping crackdown against political dissent, the city is struggling to meet one of its own benchmarks in reassuring foreign investors that it remains a predictable place to do business. item.title: Taiwan Dollar Hits Three-Year High on Trade Optimism, Exporters
item.description: Taiwan’s dollar rallied to the strongest level in three years on global stock inflows, exporters’ sales of the greenback and easing trade tensions.
item.dc:creator: Marcus Wong, Betty Hou

item.title: Why Rare Earths Are China’s Trump Card in Trade War With US
item.description: Rare earths are among the most critical raw materials on the planet, deeply embedded in the technologies that underpin modern life. Yet few people have heard of them or know what they do. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Alibaba Movie Unit’s Pivot, Rebrand Bring $2 Billion Value Gain
item.description: Damai Entertainment Holdings, formerly Alibaba Pictures Group, is shifting its focus from movies production to faster-growing entertainment segments targeting younger consumers — and investors are taking notice.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Zhu, Kelly Li

item.title: Air India Flight: Investigations begin
item.description: An Air India flight bound for London crashed Thursday, killing all but one of the 242 people on board the Boeing Co. Dreamliner in the deadliest aviation accident in more than a decade. Bloomberg's Danny Lee speaks on The Asia Trade about what we know so far. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: CATL Shares Clouded by Bleak Outlook After Mega Hong Kong Debut
item.description: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. has received little love following its splashy $5.2 billion listing in Hong Kong last month, as investors eye multifold challenges in the global EV battery market.

item.title: World’s Top Carry Trade Renews Debate Over Hong Kong Dollar Peg
item.description: An unprecedented disconnect between Hong Kong and US interest rates is fueling the world’s top-performing carry trade — and stoking a fresh debate about the long-term appeal of the city’s pegged exchange rate.

item.title: BPCE Is Nearing an Almost €7 Billion Deal for Novo Banco
item.description: Lone Star Funds has decided to pursue a sale of Portuguese lender Novo Banco SA and has entered into exclusive discussions with French banking group BPCE, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Swetha Gopinath, Pamela Barbaglia, Joao Lima, Jan-Henrik Foerster

media:content.media:description: A Novo Banco SA bank branch in Lisbon, Portugal, on Monday, June 9, 2025. Lone Star’s Portuguese lender Novo Banco attracted two bids from French banking group BPCE and CaixaBank SA of Spain, according to people familiar with the matter.
